website_summaries.verdict: A low-cost bike trainer with a few minor flaws but plenty of satisfied customers.
pros: Folds almost flat for easy storage
cons: Some concerns about durability and noise

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this once, but so far I love it. Love that it came all assembled straight out of the box. My husband had my bike set up in this in less than 15 minutes. I did a test ride of 45 minutes this morning, and it seems to work great. Not as noisy as my treadmill, and I felt like it was pretty stable. Great buy for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Ascofield

customer_reviews.title: The one with the 7 speed is good, the one without is rubbish.
customer_reviews.text: For the one without: 3 Stars Resistance is low and user manual doesn't give specific instructions but general ones. Not really loud. Works fine but resistance is an issue. Please note that different colours are different models! I bought two of these and were surprised that it is different. For the one with: 4 Stars I bought 2 different colours and it turns out that they are different models. The one with the resistance tuner works great and comes with the rest as well.
customer_reviews.author: You Don't Need To Know My Name

customer_reviews.title: Great stable trainer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this refurbished from Amazon Warehouse. It was a good price as I was trying to set up my road bike in the garage for the winter to use with me Peloton app. This did the trick. It fit perfectly onto the rear flywheel of my Bianci bike and is solid. The noise is not too bad and I'm in the garage anway with the TV sound up for the Peloton workouts. This samed me a ton of money from purchasing a new spin bike and works great.
customer_reviews.author: J. G. Sampson

customer_reviews.title: LOUD but GREAT quality for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made for the price! It also ships completely assembled and ready to use. For those of you who do not have "quick releases" on your bikes- don't worry! It still fits the back tire perfectly without it. One thing to note is that the trainer IS quite loud- though that might just be from the fact that I am using a Schwinn Mountain Bike- but if that is not an issue for you, by all means, this thing is great!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lady McCracken

customer_reviews.title: The item works great for me im a beginner cyclist i have been ...
customer_reviews.text: The item works great for me im a beginner cyclist i have been riding for about 6 months now. The trainer is a little loud but not anything that you can not tolerate but what do you expect for the price that you are paying for it. You can go out a buy a ultra quite cycle ops trainer for a heck of a lot more money but i dont see the point if you are only using this during the winter months to stay in shape in cycling season come back around again. I personally think it is a great product for the price and it serves it purpose very well.
customer_reviews.author: Regreques

customer_reviews.title: Meh !
customer_reviews.text: Instructions were very spartan on illustrations.Had to figure out on my own, which was contrary to their worded instructions They wanted the rear wheel axle replaced with theirs. Big messy hassle. The clamping device uses socket type ends that fit over the wheel nuts - existing or theirs. I just clamped it up as is and seems to work fine. 'Course as common these days they use to much plastic on hardware parts, which I hope doesn't fail as the warranty is garbage. Finally, made in China - the worst polluter on the planet. I would pay more for anything to made by a responsible democracy. Bottom line , it does work.
customer_reviews.author: whatdidtrumpdonow

customer_reviews.title: Not very well designed for anything other than easy pedaling - But it is cheap.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the off season of mountain biking. Overall I am not using it anymore. I miss my CycleOps trainer Pros: It is way cheaper than a CycleOps trainer. It holds the bike if you really crank it down and don't sprint. Cons: The flywheel is inconsistent. Not comfortable for pedaling hard There is a guard around the contact area for the tire which rubs really bad with mountain biking tires inflated to anything under 1,000psi. Noisy and restrictive Not very sturdy. If you get out of the saddle to sprint, it flexes like crazy.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Jamison

customer_reviews.title: Dual duty for your bicycle.
customer_reviews.text: I live in Oregon where it rains all winter so this is a great way to get dual use out of my bicycle. I ride it during the winter indoors for exercise, saves money not having to have a separate piece of equipment. This is also a space saving item, for apt dwellers since it eliminates the need for a separate piece of exercise equipment which takes up a lot of room all I need is my bicycle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Lover

customer_reviews.title: put the bike in the lowest gears before you start!
customer_reviews.text: I had some difficulty setting this up-be careful when you pull out the rod that goes through the back wheel to put the other one in, also, and this is very important, make sure that the bike is in the lowest gears before you even start! But finally I got it all set up, and it works beautifully!
customer_reviews.author: bluegreenwater

customer_reviews.title: Love this trainer - great value for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This trainer is fabulous! I was able to quickly set up my road bike and I was on my way to training. Some of the reviews mentioned it was very loud. I have not found this to be the case - though I have a road bike. In fact, I am surprised at how quiet it operates. I also like the fact that I can change resistance by shifting through the gears on my bike. When I'm not using the trainer, it folds up and stores away easily. I would definitely recommend this reasonably priced trainer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very basic, simple, and easy to get going.
customer_reviews.text: Good and cheap. I wasn't going to spend 100-500 dollars on something that just props up the back wheel so I can bike indoors. Just wanted something for though winter months while I watch TV
customer_reviews.author: William J. Andrus

customer_reviews.title: Sweet!
customer_reviews.text: Just got in. Took 10 minutes to setup my single speed, coaster bike and start peddling. Noise is there but it is because of the tire, not the resistance device. A smooth tire would make almost no noise but the nubbier, the tire, the more noise one will have. I really like this device so I can ride my bike for stationary exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good basic trainer
customer_reviews.text: I went with this trainer because I didn't want to invest too much in one till I knew if I'd like it and use it. I selected this trainer based on reviews, price, and ease of use. It works well and is pretty easy to set up. Only issue is getting the resistance right. I've also not noticed any issue with noise, my bike has slick tires so that may be why it is more quiet than what I read in some of the reviews. I can imagine it would be more loud if I had knobby tires but I think that would be true for any trainer.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: Very cool, why pay more?
customer_reviews.text: Very good trainer. Works as good as ones that cost hundreds more. Noise is very minimal if you are using a smooth tire. I HIGHLY recommend at least getting a smooth rear tire if you have mountain bike tires, or anything with a knobby tread. Fits really well on my Felt as well as my wife's Specialized. Local bike shop had extra rear axles that fit the trainer for under 10 dollars. It is just a generic quick release rear axle. Both our bikes came with a nicer rear axle which did not fit the trainer but this appears to be common even with the expensive brands. Get a front wheel block of some kind.
customer_reviews.author: C.F.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up to use my mountain bike inside. Works well. Changing the rear quick release was easy enough. Just be careful when you mount the bike and tighten the bike to the trainer. Don't over tighten the bracket and bend the bike frame!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I need at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I acquired an older one-speed bike and wanted an appropriate trainer to use with it. Not being sure of the degree of difficulty involved in setup, I had a bike shop show me how to do it. They did make one adjustment to make the bike and trainer compatible. They added one or two nuts to each end of the back tire's rod. Set up was then extremely simple. One note - be sure to use a level to verify the stability of the unit. Our basement floor is NOT level so additional carpet pieces were needed on one side of the trainer. I highly recommend this trainer if your circumstances are similar.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Louise

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to mount my Trek 820 Mountain Track on the ...
customer_reviews.text: Initial review. My trainer just arrived today. Very easy to mount my Trek 820 Mountain Track on the trainer. I rode my bike for about 10 minutes every thing feels very solid and sturdy. Ran my bike through all of its gears, it feels very much like riding on a flat section of street. As for the noise it is a little louder than the tires make when ridden on pavement. The tires on the Trek are the knobby kind. I have another mountain bike with street tires on it. Tomorrow I will mount it and compare the noise level and update my review.
customer_reviews.author: ScottBra9

customer_reviews.title: Can’t be used with a larger axel.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Ghost Kato MTB. It has a larger diameter axel. Didn’t realize that until trying to install bike to trainer. The trainer does seem durable and would likely work on other bikes. Just not ones like mine with larger axel.
customer_reviews.author: j

customer_reviews.title: Feels as easy as going on an even terrain or even slight ...
customer_reviews.text: It is a bit loud with the crossroad tires. Main problem - not enough resistance. Feels as easy as going on an even terrain or even slight downhill, so I gave it 2 stars initially. But when I put a smooth tire on not only did the noise decreased significantly and more importantly - the friction and hence the resistance decreased significantly, so now I can get an actual work up.
customer_reviews.author: j

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I almost love it. The bike tire when in motion, is pretty noisy. It's a great product nonetheless. If it weren't for the noise, I would have rated it 5 stars. It's definitely not any louder than going to the gym regardless. I still like it and would recommend it. Just make sure you turn when you turn your stereo to what you think is going to be "loud enough" .... crank it up even louder. Unless you have earbuds. Then you will alright. You can adjust the setting anywhere from really easy to very strenuous and really get a great workout. If you can tolerate a little noise, I highly recommend the product!
customer_reviews.author: D. P.

customer_reviews.title: The device was assembled and it was easy to attach my bike
customer_reviews.text: The device was assembled and it was easy to attach my bike. I get a great workout and use this every day to energize in the morning. After I am done I don't need coffee! The only drawback is the noise. It is not super loud, but it is noisy. I got the front wheel stabilizer too and am glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: anne fayer

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for a low end trainer
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for a low end trainer. It is a bit noisy, but was not my main objective for buying a trainer. I just like to be able to get some time on my bike when the weather is crappy for an extended period of time. This does just that.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Works with a Specialized Vita Bicycle.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! Works as advertised. My wife has a Specialized Vita but can't always leave as she has to watch the kids. This works perfectly. Easy to set up and put on/take off. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: M Golding

customer_reviews.title: Solid piece
customer_reviews.text: My husband cycles on rugged trails and loves it! Unfortunately here in Rhode Island It gets snowy and Icey and super cold and This prevents him from going out and This causes him to pout around the house. So i bought him this and he loves it. He has and aggressive tread tire which makes alot of noise while using it but that's ok. This is definitely a solid trainer. *This does not come with a front wheel support to level the bike out*
customer_reviews.author: ALICIA

customer_reviews.title: It is nice to have this set up at my home for ...
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned about noise after reading other reviews, but one can have a conversation or listen to radio at a reasonable volume. Very stable - I have never been concerned about tipping over. It is nice to have this set up at my home for those days I can't make it to the gym or hit the road. Not as much resistance as I had hoped, but that just means I have to pedal faster and/or longer to get the same cardio workout. Recommended for casual biker looking to stay in reasonable shape, but serious bikers should probably look elsewhere for a home bike solution.
customer_reviews.author: AdamK

customer_reviews.title: It does what it's supposed to do and turned my ...
customer_reviews.text: It does what it's supposed to do and turned my outdoor bike into an indoor bike. Be sure to put a mat on the back wheel because as it spins black rubber comes off but that just comes with the territory.
customer_reviews.author: Xenobia

customer_reviews.title: Used all winter
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I used this trainer almost daily all winter! I have purchased a few things from RAD cycle products and so far they have all been quality products. I also like that this trainer was reasonably priced. A few downsides are that the resistance isn't adjustable and due to the nature of these types of trainers it will EAT your rear tire. Amazon Prime shipped this trainer to me quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Tom S.

customer_reviews.title: excellent trainer for the price
customer_reviews.text: first and foremost, bike trainer are really noisy. i have a cannondale super six road bike. set up took about 5 minutes and i was off! definitely use the quick release provided so you don't mess up your bike. i just use the gears on my bike to increase or decrease tension. it is super compact which is also great. in terms of noise, my setup is as follows. i am about 6 feet from my tv with my volume on 35 out of 100 when i get on the trainer i am just as far but turn of the volume to 55 out of 100. i hear everything just fine and i'm not making a ridiculous amount of noise.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Alfano

customer_reviews.title: A great value!
customer_reviews.text: Was very pleased to see the quality build.This is a heavy duty-judy. Fit my bike and tires/wheel perfectly ( I was concerned it might not fit the 28" x 1 5/8" tires on my Schwinn Trailway Hybrid).Was so impressed that I talked my neighbor into getting one also (She loves hers, too).It is fairly quiet with regular tire treads, and the mounting system seems rock solid.Also, if you feel like taking the bike out for a ride it's a simple 30 second disconnect and you are out of the door! This is a good product and it's money well spent!
customer_reviews.author: robert randall

customer_reviews.title: As good if not better than expected...
customer_reviews.text: Not overly loud... resistance is OK... all this talk about it sounding like a vacuum cleaner to me are exaggerated. Doesn't create a LOT of resistance but enough for a moderate rider such as myself. Unit folds up very nicely and sets up in moments although I wish the mounts had some sort of quick release.
customer_reviews.author: MJP725

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I've never used a trainer before, but this product does just what it should. It allows me to get a great work-out indoors. I have road bike tires so it is very quiet and smooth. It feels like I'm out on the road. I thought the price was reasonable, the quality appears good. It folds up nicely for storage. I wish I had bought one of these sooner! The only thing it won't do is offer extreme resistance. For me when I am in my higher gears the resistance is adequate.
customer_reviews.author: Scott L

customer_reviews.title: Works even if you don’t have a quick release
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I used one of these so I’m not sure how the noise level compared to others. My bike doesn’t have a quick release rear wheel, but I was able to still attach the trainer onto the rear nuts/bolts just fine.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: loud but useful.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it, and it was fairly easy to install. Replace the lug, and mount it. It does get loud when you start pedaling. Also, keep in mind that the back tire will start to heat up. Using old one would be the best option. You tend to get used to loudness, so as you go on for more than 10minutes or so and you won't notice it anymore
customer_reviews.author: Samir

customer_reviews.title: Great for rehabilitation but noisy
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for rehabilitation after knee surgery. Available resistance worked great for my needs but I can see where it would be an issue for someone wanting to increase the resistance more. I have noticed if I try to put too much resistance on, I can smell the tire getting hot. It is noisy with a mt. bike tire. Can't really watch TV without REALLY cranking the volume. A road tire would probably be much quieter. Overall, works really well for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: Good for the money, easy installation and works good. You do need a front wheel stand 'RavX X-Block Level Block' is good enough for me, available on amazon store. Cons: 1) Loud low frequency sound for mountain bike tires, can be heard a few houses away when installed in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazen89

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! While I admit it's a bit loud (does ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! While I admit it's a bit loud (does sound like a vacuum), it's wonderful to be able to use my bike! I live in bush AK and it's just too cold! This is an easy setup -all you do is add the bike, it's already built, no tools required. It's also very light, so you can leave it attached and just move the bike setup out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: AKmeg

customer_reviews.title: I have had this for about 2 weeks and I like it alot
customer_reviews.text: Does what it is intended to do. I have had this for about 2 weeks and I like it alot, not as loud as I thought it would be from readying other reviews. It's completely tolerable. I just turn the tv up a few extra clicks. Only took a few minor adjustments to get me going. So far I have enjoyed using this trainer. I would recommend it to someone looking for an inexpensive way to keep riding their bike on the off season.
customer_reviews.author: Bee

customer_reviews.title: no noise and able to ride at home
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that it was easy to assemble and it gave me the convenience to be able to ride at home. However, it is very noisy and if you put tension on the tire it will smell like burnt rubber. it also leaves black powder on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: christopher Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great buy! Nice that it was already assembled
customer_reviews.text: Great buy! Nice that it was already assembled. It was just a bit awkward getting my bike on it but once on, was fine. As far as the noise, wasn't any louder than a gym bike. Very sturdy! I am very pleased! Got my first ride in watching it snow outside.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my husband who loves to bike when weather permits and wanted to use it for the winter months. He probably used it 2-3 times and had to stop because it is soooo loud! We live in an apartment and even bought the padding for the floor (which he uses now for weight lifting) but the machine is still super noisy. :(
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Hard to put together!
customer_reviews.text: My dad wanted to still work out on this bike in the winter so I bought this for him. We were hoping it would force him to work on his balance but it didn't serve that purpose as it keeps the bike perfectly still. There were no directions with this and I had to YouTube ho to install it... It took us about 2 hours
customer_reviews.author: Jax

customer_reviews.title: Great for indoor training
customer_reviews.text: When its raining outside and you just want to get some biking in on your bike, this is a great product for your money. It's quick and easy to use. It's a bit loud, I'd say about as loud as a vacuum cleaner. The resistance isn't all that great, but it is efficient and effective for the price. It's much cheaper than the other models that are similar.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Poirier

customer_reviews.title: Great for rainy days and cold weather.
customer_reviews.text: Great for rainy days......A little noisy, but I am using an aggressive tread mountain bike tire on it. So, I expect it to be a little loud.
customer_reviews.author: David G. Soreano

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, just OK
customer_reviews.text: I thought by buying an indoor trainer I would use it, but it does make a bit of noise (expected), and the level of resistance just can't match a good hill climb. It's not a bad unit, just OK, and I mean that it does what it's supposed to do, but for me, it's OK. I will probably use it more when Winter comes. It does not replace that wonderful feeling of riding out on the road!
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Great trainer for starters!
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great! 200+ miles so far and works wonderfully. I would also recommend going to your local bike shop and getting a bald tire for the back to reduce noise, but otherwise great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Broom

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected, but quality is so-so. Rotating ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected, but quality is so-so. Rotating "feet" are difficult to turn for height adjustment and the screw clamps holding the axle do not hold the bicycle at 90 degrees with the ground. I have to prop up one side of the device to hold the bicycle at 90 degrees so it can be ridden.
customer_reviews.author: Kysrbob

customer_reviews.title: Check your tires first
customer_reviews.text: Works well but is very very loud on my bike. I am not running road tires so that may be it. Resistance seems to be on the low side. I think with less aggressive tires I would have given it a higher rating. It isn't very heavy and is easy to store. With the right tire I think this is a winner for someone.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan G

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works fine for the cost, and is a little nosy with nobby tires.
customer_reviews.author: shiney

customer_reviews.title: not for 29" tires!!!
customer_reviews.text: Does not fit a 29 inch mountain bike. Largest tire size is 27. Wish this was stated in the description. Now I'm stuck with it bc we are about to move and don't have time to return it. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: JLK319

customer_reviews.title: Try Another One...
customer_reviews.text: I got this and at first everything seemed cool. Looks very sturdy and I like how it folds up to take less space. My opinion changed once I got it setup and started using it. The resistance is way too low even in the highest gear (21 speed mountain bike) and it makes so much noise while in use that it's very difficult to listen to tv/music without cranking the volume up to an absurd level.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

customer_reviews.title: It is still good to get a workout if it is cold outside
customer_reviews.text: As we all already know, this thing is quite loud if you have regular tires on your bike. It is very solidly built and works quite well. Even when changing gears it seems to have same resistance no matter what. It is still good to get a workout if it is cold outside. I like it other than the noise but I don't want to keep changing my tire just to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: I had an injury to my knee & ankle & needed this bike-riding motion for therapy. This worked great; my husband just brought my bike indoors & set it up as a stationary bike and I'm in business.
customer_reviews.author: Melba L. Pack

customer_reviews.title: Rad Magnetic Cycle Trainer
customer_reviews.text: A great cycle trainer at a great price. It is not as quiet as I would like it to be, but it is easy to operate and store away. I have had this item for sometime now (over a year), and have not experienced any problems with it. I use it on my GMC Denali 6061 road bike, without having to make any adjustments to the wheel. I recommend this item and the seller to all.
customer_reviews.author: Ballyu

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy bike trainer
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I have bought. I would give the first one a 5-star. The variable controller for resistance worked much better and could be adjusted on the fly. In addition, the supports that connect to the bike were sturdier as well. This still works great but miss the original.
customer_reviews.author: DataGator

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: For a very basic unit, this does what you want it to. The resistance control seems to work alright, but you're never going to be able to replicate the burn/resistance of actually pedaling some steep hills in real life. Overall, I'm satisfied and would buy it again for the price. The setup was very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Good indoor trainer
customer_reviews.text: This in door trainer works great, it is exactly what I was looking for. It was easy to set up and the noise is about what I expected. I can still watch tv while riding. Make sure to buy the front wheel holder.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Kohn

customer_reviews.title: very stable
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my bike after you crank it down tight.It`s little noisy but works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Sharer

customer_reviews.title: There are better units here for about the same price
customer_reviews.text: It works but I purchased another trainer before this one for my daughter for a little more money that has resistance settings and it is a much better unit. This one does not offer enough resistance for me if I'm doing intervals.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Latto

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably priced
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited and waited anxiously for this product. Once my husband put it together and the bike mounted on it, it's been used on a regular basis ever since. It is a little loud but just turn the volume up when you're watching tv. Other than that, for the price, it's great! It's really not as loud as some of the comments would lead you to believe. Just try it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: JRF
customer_reviews.text: Setup was relatively simple - One item that I would have made it 5 star would have been a "lock" to keep the frame open while setting it up. Rides well, keeps my bike steady. Not sure why Amazon recommended the Trip-meter/odometer with it as the front wheel does not move and the cord is not long enough to reach my back wheel. All in all a great product, would make the same purchase again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Jason.Feller

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: its ok but the wheel holder should fit rims with quick release
customer_reviews.author: Francisco gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a good deal considering comparable trainers are over 200
customer_reviews.text: I use this several times per week and it works well. I wish that I didn't have to swap out my rear skewer to go between outside and inside riding but that's really nit picking I guess. Definitely a good deal considering comparable trainers are over 200.00
customer_reviews.author: Drew B.

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for the money. The noise complaints from other reviewers are likely due to improper tire choices, the trainer itself produces very little noise. Given that your tire is physically contacting the trainer roller, any tread whatsoever will cause noise, even on a much more expensive model a knobby tire would be obnoxiously loud. Buy yourself a slick road tire or "home trainer tire" and you shouldn't have any noise complaints. The product seems well built and sturdy, setup was quick, I had it ready to go in less than 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: williamwoodams

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a cheap and easy solution to workout indoors. I have a small house and no where to put big, bulky workout equipment. This rack allows me to easily take down my bike from the garage and hook it to the rack to work out. If I need to move the bike back out, I can easily unhook it and then store the rack in the closet. Very good for space! The rack is strong and seems to offer good resistance. I feel very stable. It is a little loud, but then I think most stationary bikes are. For the affordability and portability I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mystic2girl

customer_reviews.title: Loud and Problem With Resistance
customer_reviews.text: Other reviews were not exaggerating - this thing is LOUD; much more so than my treadmill. I also could not get enough resistance, even with adjustments. Sent back.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed. Sturdy and Easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Ive been researching a lot for this indoor training things. Believe me when I say this is one of the most quality-price models youre going to get. Im 220lbs and I feel very safe and steady. Easy setup (less than 10mins and Im no bike expert). I dont care about the humming noise it makes (not as loud as others point ou), just crank the ipod and start pedaling. Happy!
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Arturo Nunez Sabal

customer_reviews.title: Excellent - on par with more expensive brand name trainers
customer_reviews.text: What a great trainer! My $300 trainer got bent during my cross-country move. I really didn't want to drop $150+ on a new trainer so I decided to give this one a try. I've been very impressed with the quality and I love that it folds for easier storage.
customer_reviews.author: Jen G.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, easy to set up. I would get a tire to use just with this one that's somewhat worn or less knobby than a mountain bike tire so the noise level is lowered.
customer_reviews.author: infojunkee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what you want it for...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because I was looking for a solid but not too expensive indoor bike trainer. This was easy to set up and within 15 min I was able to start riding my road bike indoors during the cold midwestern winters. One thing is make sure the floor you use it on is level. Great product and extremely happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Carbonaro

customer_reviews.title: Great trainer for the price!!
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about this trainer! Highly recommend for someone looking for an inexpensive trainer!
customer_reviews.author: Diane Payne

customer_reviews.title: Product is well made.
customer_reviews.text: High quality product ,reasonably priced. Well worth the money I spent. Recommend this product to anybody.Thank You for your loyal business.
customer_reviews.author: Jap C. L.

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Great for bike riding indoors during winter, easy assembly and setup. Good resistance and not too noisy, fairly small foot print.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Great for small spaces
customer_reviews.text: I just had ACL surgery and am using this to strengthen my muscles so I can get back to commuting to work again. This set up in minutes and works great. It's not that loud - I can carry on a conversation, but maybe not watch a movie/TV unless the volume was turned up quite a bit. For my purposes, it is a great choice as I only need to train about 30 minutes at a time, max.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Rad Mag Bike Trainer
customer_reviews.text: This is my first bike trainer. It was easy to set up and adjust the resistance. I thought it was fairly quiet. Rode for 30 minutes and got a great workout considering I haven't ridden since it snowed here. I used it with my classic road bike with slick tires. This will really keep me in shape until Spring comes!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: This just doesn't work as I had hoped. I ...
customer_reviews.text: This just doesn't work as I had hoped. I may just buy a separate stationary bike. It's just not a smooth ride at all.
customer_reviews.author: RKStevens

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for. solid built, affordable, little noise but do not care.
customer_reviews.author: zazblue

customer_reviews.title: kind of noisy and bike didn't fit it at first ...
customer_reviews.text: kind of noisy and bike didn't fit it at first. had to work around and figure out a way to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: The Exponent

customer_reviews.title: ::::: Loud ---But OK for Weekend Warriors::::::
customer_reviews.text: I am not a super athlete, just a middle aged fat guy with some heart problems. This unit is fine for guys like me, cannot speak for serious athletes though. Pros: Price Ease of Use Cons: It really is NOISY when adjusted to resist the rider Pot metal wing nuts on the back wheel attachments Mildly "El-Cheapo" feel to it, but adequate for the intended use. Not sure why something like this could not be made in the USA at a decent price, really not a lot to it. Weekend warrior? Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Nessmuk's Nephew

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a good trainer, but I need help with something!
customer_reviews.text: Hi, I bought this trainer to put my fixed gear on it. Does anyone know why my bike chain keeps coming off? Do fixed gear bikes not work with bike trainers? I used to have a mountain bike, but thought a fixie would be ok to use. I obviously am a bike novice. Please help! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: SurfingPanda

customer_reviews.title: The product is great Unfortunately for me I ordered the wrong size my ...
customer_reviews.text: The product is great Unfortunately for me I ordered the wrong size my bike is a 29 and rad cycle only goes up to 27 Now I’m stuck with a brand new product I can’t use
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: does as advertised...not for mountain bikes, as far as the 'noisy' reviews...
customer_reviews.text: people complain about the noise of the product which is somewhat true...if you have a mountain bike with knubby tires, it'll make quite some noise as expected, but a street bike, i'm guessing will not pose such an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Easy to hook up bike
customer_reviews.text: Why: I bought this trainer to help build up strength after having both my menisci repaired. Pro's: Easy to hook up bike. Cons: Like others said it's as loud as a vacuum cleaner and I was unable to hear the training video. My 3 year old son asked me to stop riding because it was too noisy. Overview: If your not concerned about noise than this is the trainer for you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money on this product
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money on this product. There is almost no tension even when fully tightened, so no work out. Spend the extra money and get a better quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Sisky BB

customer_reviews.title: NO NOISE
customer_reviews.text: USED IT ON OLD RACER BIKE WITH SMOOTH TIRES. NO NOISE AS SOME HAVE COMPLAINED ABOUT. GOOD VALUE. CHEAPER THAN BUYING TREADMILL, ETC. IF YOU HAVE A BIKE. WILL NOT WORK WITH GEARS THAT HAVE SHIFTING MECHANISM IN REAR AXLE. MOUNT ONLY ALLOWS A STRAIGHT AXLE.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Reising

customer_reviews.title: It was put together but i had a bike too ...
customer_reviews.text: It was put together but i had a bike too old to fit the trainer must have a quick release rear wheel
customer_reviews.author: Laelu4usa

customer_reviews.title: Good, but...
customer_reviews.text: Works ok but missing a couple of parts and had to adapt some things from garage
customer_reviews.author: Trey

customer_reviews.title: Good Value!!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. Holds bike in place and no wobbling. It is loud, but when you are working out you just tune it out. Good Value!
customer_reviews.author: Clinz

customer_reviews.title: Beware!
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, poorly made product that first came with missing parts and after Amazon replaced it, would not work with my Mongoose bicycle. Check first to learn exactly what bikes will and won't work with this horrible product.
customer_reviews.author: kiburi

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: This trainer is really simple and very sturdy. It does make a medium amount of noise and doesn't a whole lot of resistance. Only about as much as riding on a slight up-hill grade. I am using it to recover from a knee surgery and it does the job just fine. As well as, saving me a whole lot of $. Using this, I don't have to pay a physical therapist's office to just go and use their's.
customer_reviews.author: joseph the third

customer_reviews.title: The use of this is perfect!
customer_reviews.text: My husband uses this for his bike when the weather isn't nice. It's easy for him to take on and off to go from inside to outside with his bike. It is a little loud but worth it instead of buying a expensive workout machine you can only use inside.
customer_reviews.author: therman

customer_reviews.title: Too loud with not enough resistance
customer_reviews.text: First, it's way too loud, and second, the resistance is terrible. I read similar reviews before and ignored them, which was obviously a mistake. I'm returning it.
customer_reviews.author: CourtneyC

customer_reviews.title: item exceded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: I was pleased as how quickly the item came. It was easy to set up and put my bike on it. I have used it several times and like the stand as well as feeling very stable on it. It has helped change my outdoor bike to an indoor bike during the bad weather.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Great trainer
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. Doesn't make a lot of noise. We put a mat down under it and the bike. I ride it daily, usually while watching the news. You do have to turn the sound up on the TV, but not by much. Its sturdy and doesn't shift around. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: M. Old

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but...
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice product, strong, sturdy and easy to use but it is a bit noisier than I expected. seems simple enough after taking it apart but nothing I did could quiet it down. thrown on some headphones and you'll be fine.
customer_reviews.author: jamk35

customer_reviews.title: RAD cycle trainer
customer_reviews.text: Great mobility with the folding. Easy to connect and disconnect. A little loud but I have nobby tires on my moutain bike so I attribute it to that. Just wear your iPod and you won't notice too much. Solid build quality and light weight. Great for those cold winter days.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Works as described. Change gears to increase friction. ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. Change gears to increase friction. I used it in high gear most of the time. Friction could be a little more.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: I like the product
customer_reviews.text: Many of the reviews comment on how loud this product is and they are right, it is very loud. I have to crank up the TV to almost full blast to hear it over the rumbling. That being said, I like the product, it does what it is suppose to do and I am able to train on my own bike. I'm sure with a different magnet design, the developers could decrease the noise, but it is far cheaper than purchasing an exercise bike or other exercise equipment, so I will take the noise over the cost.
customer_reviews.author: ElleRey

customer_reviews.title: Does make a lot of noise. I mainly use ...
customer_reviews.text: Does make a lot of noise. I mainly use it in the winters while watching tv and I have to turn the tv volume up more than I would want to.
customer_reviews.author: Ledjan Qato

customer_reviews.title: Low cost but noisy
customer_reviews.text: Admittedly this is about as cheap as it gets, so that's good on the wallet. However the set i received was noisy and vibrated a lot. Turned out that the main shaft for the roller was not machined true. The roller surface is also not exactly the smoothest of surfaces around and it looks like it was cut with a blunt tool. Since then i have gotten myself another trainer which was about double the price but the difference in noise and vibrations is worth it Overall ok for low speed spins on a budget but nothing else.
customer_reviews.author: Ojuic3

customer_reviews.title: No more snow days!
customer_reviews.text: I really love it! It gives me the work out I miss on those nasty snow days!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Boddeker

product_meta.title: RAD Cycle Bike Trainer Indoor Bicycle Exercise Portable Work Out Cycle with Smooth Magnetic Resistance Allows You to Work Out with Your Bike
product_meta.description:
Featured on "The Doctors" TV Show! See the video! 

 Train indoors all winter long!
Hooks up to just about any bike--including road and mountain bikes
with a 26", 27" or 700c wheel!! 

 Get off the couch and onto the state of the art MAG TRAINER by RAD Cycle Products. Out of all the trainers we tested, none of them compared to price and the quality of this trainer! Regardless of the weather outside you will be able to stay in shape. The MAG Trainer converts your bike into an indoor cycling trainer. It utilizes a state of the art magnet system which provides magnetic resistance. You can easily increase the resistance by shifting the gears on your bike! These are perfect for the beginner or the professional who wants to stay in shape all yearlong! This MAG Traineris one of the quietest on the market--it is a premium quality unit. Now you can watch TV and ride your bike. 

 Features: 

 *  State of the art technology.
   As soon as you begin to pedal, the ultra QUIET internal magnet creates resistance. 
 *  Extremely Portable.
   The MAG Trainer is extremely light. and it can be compacted--folded down like an ironing board--for travel and storage. 
 *  Maximum Stability.
   The MAG Trainer is one of the most robust and sturdy trainers on the market. Extra wide legs and a sturdy frame makes this the trainer the pros choose. 
 *  Extra Durable.
   The MAG Trainer features the finest materials and proven reliability.We stand behind every product we sell and back it up with a 100%satisfaction guarantee. 

 Additional Features: 

 * Designed for bikes with quick release rear axle. 
 * Features separated legs for added stability. 
 * Includes an 850 gram machined steel flywheel for the most natural pedal feel. 
 * Quick release foot pedal system always keeps same tire pressure. 
 * Includes a quick release skewer. 
 * Fits 700c (Road) or 26 in.(Mountain) wheels with different tire sizes. 
 * Folds for easy storage. See photos. 
 *  Riser Block NOT Included, sold separately.
feature_bullets: ►STATE OF THE ART - As soon as you begin to pedal, the ultra QUIET internal magnet creates resistance. You can easily increase the resistance by shifting the gears on your bike!
►EXTREMELY PORTABLE - The MAG Trainer is extremely light and it can be folded down like an ironing board for travel and storage
►MAXIMUM STABILITY - This trainer is one of the most robust and sturdy trainers on the market. Extra wide legs and a sturdy frame makes this the trainer the pros choose
►EXTRA DURABLE - features the finest materials and proven reliability. We stand behind every product we sell and back it up with a 100% satisfaction guarantee
►VERSATILITY - Turn your bike into an indoor exercise bike, easy set-up and quiet operation, riser block NOT included.
